docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting of the Board Friday evening, a quorum did not arrive until 5 1/2 P. M., when the roll was called, and the Board proceeded to business--RICHARD T. COMPTON, Esq., in the Chair Petitions Referred.--Of Cataract Engine Co. No. 25, for a new location. 0' Jeremiah Crowly and others, to have nuisance abated at the foot of Thirty third street, East River.

docs.lead_paragraph: Though the kindness of Mr. ALEXANDER McWHINNEY, now a resident of Australia, for merly of Kingston, Jamaica, we yesterday received a file of the Melbourne Argus to June 10. Mr. McWHINNEY left Kingston about a year since, with his own family, and a large number of others, in a brig which he had chartered for the trip. The company comprised some fifty four adults and several children.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. Sentences of the Eighteenth Ward Rioters. Before Judge Heebe.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the sitting of the Court, yesterday morning, the Eighteenth Ward rioters, who had been convicted on the previous Tuesday were placed at the bar. On the use the question being put, as to what they had to say why sentence should not be awarded against them,...

headline.main: THE FISHERY SQUADRON.; Arrival at Prince Edward's Island--Official Dinner to the Commodore--Speeches, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Princeton arrived here on Thursday night, from Pictou. Capt. WATSON got in at early dinner, and was snugly berthed, when Sea-sloth came screwing along at 9 P. M. In the course of the run she got her speed up to eight knots, and then the certain consequence followed--an alarm of fire.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; IMPORTANT DECISION. Duty of the Comptroller in paying City Bills. Judge Edmonds' Decision in the Mandamns Case. SUPREME COURT Board of Assistants COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. BOARD OF EDUCATION. Court of General Sessions. CITY LAW-COURTS. SUPERIOR COURT Stated Meeting UNITED STATES MARSHAL'S OFFICE. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT. MARINE COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Hon. John Edmonds. In re The People excel William B. Reynolds vs A C Flagg, Comptroller--His Honor delivered the following opinion in this important controversy between (in fact) the Corporation and the chief officer of the Financial Department. The decision assumes a very grave importance from the fact that it will operate on a large number of other claims against the Corporation.

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; Mr. Walker's Declination of the Chinese Mission--His Health--Appointments, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. ROBERT J. WALKER'S resignation of the Chinese Mission is matter for profound regret in all circles here, as well on account of its real cause, as for the loss of the services of so able and distinguished a diplomatist. What that cause is,...

docs.lead_paragraph: In New-Orleans, Sept. 8, after a brief illness of five days, WALTER SCOTT SEARING, in the 21st year of his age, a ?? of Newark, N. J. In the midst of health and strength, and rejoicing in the promises of youth, the fell destroyer has ?? a?? other victim, and given another mournful proof of the uncertainty of life.
